name: Masala Dosa
steps: Soak rice and urad dal overnight.
Grind into a smooth batter and ferment for 8 hours.
Prepare potato filling with mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions and boiled potatoes.
Spread dosa batter on a hot tawa.
Place potato filling and fold dosa.
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.
author: Chef Ananya Rao

name: Rajma Chawal
steps: Soak rajma overnight and pressure cook until soft.
Prepare masala with onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Add boiled rajma and cook for 15-20 mins.
Serve hot with steamed basmati rice.
author: Chef Rohan Mehta

name: Pav Bhaji
steps: Boil mixed vegetables like potatoes, peas, and carrots.
Mash and cook with butter, onions, tomatoes, and pav bhaji masala.
Toast pav buns with butter.
Serve hot with lemon and onions.
author: Chef Preeti Shah

name: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for 6 hours.
Cook chicken in a tandoor or oven.
Prepare creamy tomato-based gravy.
Add chicken to gravy and simmer for 10 mins.
Add butter and cream before serving.
author: Chef Arjun Khanna

name: Gulab Jamun
steps: Make dough using khoya and flour.
Shape into small balls and deep fry.
Prepare sugar syrup with cardamom and rose water.
Soak fried balls in warm syrup.
Serve warm or cold.
author: Chef Nisha Kulkarni

name: Sprouted Moong Salad
steps: Soak and sprout green moong for 2 days.
Mix with chopped onions, tomatoes, cucumber, and coriander.
Add lemon juice and black salt.
Toss and serve chilled.
author: Chef Tanvi Desai

name: Kaju Katli
steps: Grind cashews to a fine powder.
Cook with sugar and water until thick.
Roll mixture and cut into diamond shapes.
Garnish with silver foil (varak).
author: Chef Vinod Patel

name: Chole Bhature
steps: Soak and pressure cook chole.
Prepare masala with onion, tomato, and chole masala.
Knead dough for bhature and let it rest.
Roll and deep fry bhature.
Serve hot with chole, onion, and pickle.
author: Chef Meera Bansal

name: Lassi
steps: Blend curd, sugar, and water.
Add cardamom or rose essence.
Serve chilled with a dollop of cream.
author: Chef Harjit Singh

name: Tomato Shorba
steps: Cook tomatoes with garlic, onion, and spices.
Blend into a smooth puree.
Simmer and strain.
Serve hot with coriander garnish.
author: Chef Priya Menon

name: Aloo Tikki
steps: Boil and mash potatoes.
Mix with spices and breadcrumbs.
Shape into tikkis and shallow fry.
Serve with chutney and curd.
author: Chef Ravi Joshi

name: Paneer Tikka
steps: Marinate paneer cubes with curd and spices.
Skewer and grill till charred.
Serve with mint chutney.
author: Chef Kavita Shah

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
steps: Marinate chicken with spices and curd.
Layer half-cooked rice and marinated chicken.
Seal and cook on dum for 45 mins.
Serve with raita and mirchi ka salan.
author: Chef Imran Hussain

name: Vegetable Upma
steps: Roast semolina (rava) till golden.
Sauté veggies with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add water and bring to boil.
Add rava gradually and stir.
Cook until thickened.
author: Chef Ritu Sinha

name: Mango Lassi
steps: Blend mango pulp, curd, and sugar.
Add cardamom and a pinch of salt.
Serve chilled with mint leaves.
author: Chef Neha Grover

name: Rasgulla
steps: Prepare chenna from curdled milk.
Knead and shape into balls.
Boil in sugar syrup until fluffy.
Cool and serve chilled.
author: Chef Sandeep Roy

name: Tandoori Roti
steps: Prepare dough with whole wheat flour.
Roll into flat circles.
Bake in tandoor or oven till brown spots appear.
Brush with ghee and serve hot.
author: Chef Alka Sharma

name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch and puree spinach leaves.
Sauté onion, tomato, and ginger.
Add spinach puree and paneer cubes.
Cook for 10 mins and serve hot.
author: Chef Dhruv Bajaj

name: Falooda
steps: Soak falooda sev and basil seeds separately.
Layer in glass with rose syrup, sev, basil seeds, milk, and ice cream.
Garnish with dry fruits.
author: Chef Zoya Siddiqui

name: Hakka Noodles
steps: Boil noodles and keep aside.
Sauté vegetables in oil with garlic and soy sauce.
Add noodles and stir-fry.
Season and serve hot.
author: Chef Aryan Malhotra
